alert.note: Alert for Dubois; Perry (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 4:58AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Dubois, northern Crawford, northwestern Perry, Orange and southwestern Washington Counties through 545 AM EST/445 AM CST/... At 457 AM EST/357 AM CST/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Santa Claus, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... English and Paoli. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
